revised_title: Insect Saliva and Plant Virus Transmission: A Study on Cicadulina mbila
tldr: The author investigates the role of insect saliva in the transmission of plant viruses, specifically focusing on the leafhopper Cicadulina mbila. They observe the process of saliva excretion and its potential role in virus transmission, finding that the saliva forms a sheath around the insect's stylets and may play a role in virus inoculation into plants. The study provides insights into the mechanism of virus transmission by insect vectors and the role of saliva in this process.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Entomology and Virology
